data.meta_description: gpt3]Summarize this content to 100 words: Ben Kingsley is an accomplished British actor whose work over the past fifty years has been critically acclaimed. He has won many prestigious awards such as the Oscar, BAFTA, Grammy, and Golden Globe. Additionally, he has been nominated for four Primetime Emmy Awards and two Laurence Olivier Awards, solidifying his status as a highly respected and talented performer in the entertainment industry. contour Full name: Ben Kingsley Stage name: Ben Kingsley Date of birth: December 31, 1943 Age: 80 Birthplace: Snainton, England Nationality: British Occupation: Actor Height: 1.73 m Parents: Rahimtulla Harji Bhanji, Anna Lyna Mary Goodman Siblings: Ferdinand Kingsley, Jasmine Benjy, Edmund Kingsley, Thomas Alexis Benjy Spouses: Angela Morant, Alison Sutcliffe, Alexandra Chrisman, Daniela Lavender Children: Thomas Bhanji, artist Jasmin Bhanji, Edmund Kingsley, Ferdinand Kingsley Relationship: Married Net worth: $60 million Early life and education Ben Kingsley is an outstanding British actor, born on December 31, 1943 in Snainton, England. His parents were Rahimtulla Harji Bhanji and Anna Lyna Mary Goodman. Kingsley grew up with four siblings: Ferdinand Kingsley, Jasmin Bhanji, Edmund Kingsley, and Thomas Alexis Bhanji. He was educated at Manchester Grammar School, where his classmate was the actor Robert Powell. After graduating from Manchester Grammar School, Kingsley went on to study at De La Salle College in Salford, which later became the home of the Ben Kingsley Theatre. Profession Ben Kingsley's passion for acting was evident at an early age. He devoted himself to honing his craft at the renowned Royal Shakespeare Company, performing classic Shakespearean roles such as Hamlet and King Lear. Although he had acted in a few films before this, it was Kingsley's portrayal of Mahatma Gandhi in Richard Attenborough's biopic that really showcased his talent. His nuanced performance earned him international acclaim and an Academy Award for Best Actor, solidifying his status as one of the most talented actors in the industry. This is a testament to Kingsley's versatility and talent as an actor. He can play a variety of roles, from heroes to villains, and captivate the audience with his performance. Although best known for his iconic role as Gandhi, Kingsley continues to challenge himself to play diverse and complex characters, cementing his place as one of the greatest actors of our time. Kingsley's talent is undeniable. He has won many awards, including the Oscar, the British Academy of Film Awards, the Golden Globe Awards, and the Grammy Awards. He was also awarded a knighthood for his contribution to the British film industry. Although best known for his film work, Kingsley has always stayed true to his theatrical roots. He continues to perform on prestigious stages around the world and is always highly acclaimed. Awards and nominations Oscar: Best Actor for Gandhi (1982) BAFTA Award: Best Actor for Gandhi (1982) Grammy Award: Best Spoken Word or Non-Musical Recording for "Gandhi's Words" (1984) Golden Globe Award: Best Actor in a Drama Film for Gandhi (1982) Screen Actors Guild Award: Outstanding Supporting Actor for Schindler's List (1993) Knighthood: Knighted by Queen Elizabeth II for services to the British film industry (2002) Hollywood Walk of Fame: Received a star (2010) Academy Awards: Nominated for Best Supporting Actor for Bugsy (1991), Sexy Beast (2000), Best Actor for House of Sand and Fog (2003) Primetime Emmy Awards: four nominations for Outstanding Lead Actor or Supporting Actor in a Limited Series or Movie Laurence Olivier Awards: Nominated for Best Actor and Best Comedy Performance social media Ben Kingsley does not have any social media accounts. personal life Ben Kingsley, 80, has been married four times. His first wife was actress Angela Morant, with whom he had two children: Thomas Benji and artist Jasmine Benji. After his divorce, he married theatre director Alison Sutcliffe, with whom he had two sons, Edmund Kingsley and Ferdinand Kingsley, who both became actors. After his second divorce, Kingsley married Alexandra Christman. However, the marriage ended in 2005. In 2007, he married his current wife, Brazilian actress Daniela Lavender. net worth Sir Ben Kingsley has been a prominent figure in the entertainment industry for decades, renowned for his exceptional talent and versatility. With a net worth of $60 million, he has earned a considerable amount of wealth through his successful career. From his early stage performances to his award-winning performances on the big screen, Kingsley has proven himself to be a skilled and respected actor, solidifying his place as one of the most talented and successful actors in the industry. data.text:
Ben Kingsley is an accomplished British actor whose work over the past fifty years has been critically acclaimed.

He has won many prestigious awards such as the Oscar, BAFTA, Grammy, and Golden Globe.

You are watching: Ben Kingsley Biography: Wife, Height, Age, Net Worth, Movies, Instagram, Parents, Children, IMDb, Siblings

Additionally, he has been nominated for four Primetime Emmy Awards and two Laurence Olivier Awards, solidifying his status as a highly respected and talented performer in the entertainment industry.

contour

Full name: Ben Kingsley

Stage name: Ben Kingsley

Date of birth: December 31, 1943

Age: 80

Birthplace: Snainton, England

Nationality: British

Occupation: Actor

Height: 1.73 m

Parents: Rahimtulla Harji Bhanji, Anna Lyna Mary Goodman

Siblings: Ferdinand Kingsley, Jasmine Benjy, Edmund Kingsley, Thomas Alexis Benjy

Spouses: Angela Morant, Alison Sutcliffe, Alexandra Chrisman, Daniela Lavender

Children: Thomas Bhanji, artist Jasmin Bhanji, Edmund Kingsley, Ferdinand Kingsley

Relationship: Married

Net worth: $60 million

Early life and education

Ben Kingsley is an outstanding British actor, born on December 31, 1943 in Snainton, England.

His parents were Rahimtulla Harji Bhanji and Anna Lyna Mary Goodman. Kingsley grew up with four siblings: Ferdinand Kingsley, Jasmin Bhanji, Edmund Kingsley, and Thomas Alexis Bhanji.

He was educated at Manchester Grammar School, where his classmate was the actor Robert Powell.

After graduating from Manchester Grammar School, Kingsley went on to study at De La Salle College in Salford, which later became the home of the Ben Kingsley Theatre.

Profession

See more : Mitchell Musso Biography: Net Worth, Movies and TV Shows, Age, Songs, Height, Girlfriend, Brother, Wiki

Ben Kingsley’s passion for acting was evident at an early age. He devoted himself to honing his craft at the renowned Royal Shakespeare Company, performing classic Shakespearean roles such as Hamlet and King Lear.

Although he had acted in a few films before this, it was Kingsley’s portrayal of Mahatma Gandhi in Richard Attenborough’s biopic that really showcased his talent.

His nuanced performance earned him international acclaim and an Academy Award for Best Actor, solidifying his status as one of the most talented actors in the industry.

This is a testament to Kingsley’s versatility and talent as an actor. He can play a variety of roles, from heroes to villains, and captivate the audience with his performance.

Although best known for his iconic role as Gandhi, Kingsley continues to challenge himself to play diverse and complex characters, cementing his place as one of the greatest actors of our time.

Kingsley’s talent is undeniable. He has won many awards, including the Oscar, the British Academy of Film Awards, the Golden Globe Awards, and the Grammy Awards.

He was also awarded a knighthood for his contribution to the British film industry. Although best known for his film work, Kingsley has always stayed true to his theatrical roots. He continues to perform on prestigious stages around the world and is always highly acclaimed.

Awards and nominations

Oscar: Best Actor for Gandhi (1982)

BAFTA Award: Best Actor for Gandhi (1982)

Grammy Award: Best Spoken Word or Non-Musical Recording for “Gandhi’s Words” (1984)

Golden Globe Award: Best Actor in a Drama Film for Gandhi (1982)

Screen Actors Guild Award: Outstanding Supporting Actor for Schindler’s List (1993)

Knighthood: Knighted by Queen Elizabeth II for services to the British film industry (2002)

Hollywood Walk of Fame: Received a star (2010)

Academy Awards: Nominated for Best Supporting Actor for Bugsy (1991), Sexy Beast (2000), Best Actor for House of Sand and Fog (2003)

Primetime Emmy Awards: four nominations for Outstanding Lead Actor or Supporting Actor in a Limited Series or Movie

Laurence Olivier Awards: Nominated for Best Actor and Best Comedy Performance

social media

Ben Kingsley does not have any social media accounts.

personal life

See more : Tom Felton Biography: Wife, Age, Parents, Children, Net Worth, TV Shows, Height, Movies, Books

Ben Kingsley, 80, has been married four times. His first wife was actress Angela Morant, with whom he had two children: Thomas Benji and artist Jasmine Benji.

After his divorce, he married theatre director Alison Sutcliffe, with whom he had two sons, Edmund Kingsley and Ferdinand Kingsley, who both became actors.

After his second divorce, Kingsley married Alexandra Christman. However, the marriage ended in 2005. In 2007, he married his current wife, Brazilian actress Daniela Lavender.

net worth

Sir Ben Kingsley has been a prominent figure in the entertainment industry for decades, renowned for his exceptional talent and versatility.

With a net worth of $60 million, he has earned a considerable amount of wealth through his successful career.

From his early stage performances to his award-winning performances on the big screen, Kingsley has proven himself to be a skilled and respected actor, solidifying his place as one of the most talented and successful actors in the industry.
